title: Council in the Hollow Chain
description: Night peels down the Chainbridge as if a patient hand were unwrapping fruit, lifting the pivoting panel in a sigh of oiled iron and revealing the ladder into the Shard’s collar cavity. The river’s breath turns to low blue fog as you descend, and the hum within the iron throat of the bridge mingles with the deeper note that lives in the Shard like a held bell. Prisms of shed crystal are bolted into the ribs of the chamber, their facets drinking dusk and sweating a faint glow that makes silhouettes into fables, and fables into witnesses denied. Vows have lived and died here without ink, and decisions have hung like knives between heartbeat and ledger, cutting futures without leaving a blood trail for law to follow. The palimpsest’s timing was true, for the shapes below are arranged like pieces already counted: Thane Kelvar upright as a tide-clock, a stern warden in Order blue whose posture is as sharp as her ward-etches, and a masked silhouette that smells of black-sap and orchard shade, a splinter of a gardener who prunes rumors rather than branches. Their plan breathes like a forge banked for a storm, and every breath tastes of copper and quiet ambition: provoke a hum-falter, jar supply lines until they rattle apart, sell a private glow while the city begs, and press the debt-ring closed while the Shard’s song is choked with a careful chord. You cannot fight iron beams and fog with a barge-hook alone, not when words are the true blades in the room. You must listen with the patience of a riverstone, take their phrases like evidence into your hands without cutting your palms, and climb away with your skin intact and the city’s chance for dawn unbroken.
objectives: Use the collar cavity entrance at mid-span to infiltrate the secret council.
Eavesdrop on the plan to quiet the Shard and privatize light without revealing yourself.
Secure a token or phrase that proves Thane Kelvar’s complicity.
Escape via the maintenance ladder to the toll tower without being captured.

dialogue.speaker: Neris Aline
dialogue.lines: We timed our descent to the tide-change because the Chainbridge sighs then, and iron voices hide human ones if you breathe with them. Count the hums in sets of seven and step only when the note dips, for that is when the collar’s prisms veil motion with afterlight and the fog drapes heavier on the eye. You must not draw steel unless breath turns to blood, because a wound here would ring through the girders and call watchers who serve no banner but panic. Listen first and measure their words as if they were weights on a scale, because we need a phrase or a token that cannot be denied under oath or under the Order’s wards. Thane Kelvar favors tide-clock ciphers and knots his metaphors to minutes, so he will reveal himself if he grows proud of his own counting. The masked one will try to make mercy sound like a muffled lullaby, and the warden will speak of legal tempering as if she were merely tuning a bell, not choking it. If you are seen, climb for the toll tower and trust the maintenance ladder’s old bolts, because I greased them myself with a whisper of harp-oil and a prayer to friction. Bring back something that fits a courtroom’s tongue and a riverman’s sense of right, and I will turn every lens in the Collegium to magnify it until even the Twelve Seals cannot look away.

dialogue.speaker: Thane Kelvar
dialogue.lines: Scarcity is a ship, and ships are not tragedies but instruments, so long as a steady hand holds the tiller and knows the shoals by name. We do not have to drown our neighbors to profit, because panic does the drowning for us while we stand on the deck and offer ropes at prices that teach respect for balance. The Shard’s public glow warms idle hands and feeds wasteful nights, so a season of gentle dimming will sharpen habits and knead gratitude into every household ledger. We will sell a private dawn to those who can afford haste, and rent patient twilight to the rest, and to all we will speak softly of discipline until they repeat the word as if it were a hymn they chose. If a few chains snap in the markets and a few convoys slow at the fens, the city will learn the arithmetic of need and the relief of paying for certainty. When the song is quieted by a lawful chord and the Order finds its purse heavier for guarding reason, our ledgers will sing a harmony no rival can outvoice. Remember, we do not steal, we price, and none can call theft what the market names a virtue.

dialogue.speaker: Masked Voice
dialogue.lines: Discipline is a limb that must not be mistaken for the heart, and cruelty is a rot that dresses itself in bandages of math when nobody looks too closely. A pruning is needed when branches overgrow the path and scratch children’s cheeks, but a gardener who cuts the trunk becomes a woodcutter and cannot claim care. We will quiet the song until words can be heard again in this frantic city, and then we will choose which words get to speak first and which must wait their turn in shade. The cord that ties the thrashing patient is not a chain if it loosens with a question and tightens only with lies, but I have found that silk binds better than hemp because it coaxes pride to sleep. Tell yourselves that mercy sometimes sounds like distance, and the city will thank the hand that kept it from running headlong into its own reflection. For those who cannot hear the lesson, we have invisible gardeners who will pluck a rumor here and a habit there until the canopy clears and the roots drink softly again.

dialogue.speaker: Lysa Shardhands
dialogue.lines: You throw stones at doctrine as if it were a window, Thane, but you forget that doctrine is also a scaffolding that holds the tower from tilting when winds turn theatrical. The Order does not kneel to coin, yet we do count days and weigh harms, and there is a line between muting a sacred note and placing a palm on the bell to still its trembling before a storm. If we call this a trial of harmonics, framed by safety and sealed by ward-oaths, I can speak it into the court with a face that does not flinch and a mouth that does not lie. The Shard faltered once for seven breaths, and in those breaths I heard fear turn to knives in the crowd, so do not preach to me about the price of quiet; I paid it with my own name on the writ. We will require proper seals, and you will keep your merchants’ chatter behind the bolt until the city thanks the Order for having watched the measure. Cross me with greed and I will snap your fingers in the door of the Bastion, but honor the staged stillness and I will say that what we did was to keep the people from stampeding off the bridge and into the flood.

dialogue.speaker: Jaryn Chainwake (whispered)
dialogue.lines: A kindness that sells ropes and calls them hands is a lie that the river will spit back as foam when the first thaw comes. Your numbers will glaze like frost on bad glass and shatter at dawn when the children breathe on the panes, and I will not let you hang weights on their sleep to teach them the math of obedience. I have hauled chains with callused palms and listened to bells through rain, and I know the difference between a safety hold and a strangler’s grin. The Gardener’s perfume sits sweet and clean on a blade I cannot see, and the warden’s words are nails tapped with an alabaster hammer so the blood does not show on the white. I will bring a phrase or a token like a river-stone that even your clever ledgers cannot carve smooth, and I will ring it on the House of Reconciliation’s table until the city looks up from its bowls to hear the truth. Breathe, step, listen, and climb, Jaryn, and remember that a chain can be a bridge when held by honest hands, and a prison when tallied in a counting hall.

choices.title: Listen Like Stone, Move Like Mist
choices.text: You press your back to the collar’s rib and count the Shard’s undertone in sevens until its dips cover your shifts. Every breath becomes a measure and every blink an oar stroke through fog, and you let your prism-lamp rest dark so that your eyes learn the map of this blue cavern by patience alone. Thane’s voice rises with the pride of a man who loves his own metaphors, and you watch his hand sketch time in the air as if he were winding an invisible tide-clock. He repeats a phrase that has the ring of a cipher, the kind that opens ledgers and meetings, and he says it twice because he enjoys the sound of his own cleverness. You mouth the words silently to memorize their weight on the tongue, and you note the exact moment his fingers tap a tide-mark on the iron because a good phrase always carries a gesture. When their silhouettes loosen with the comfort of hearing themselves, you fold your patience into your feet and make for the ladder, carrying the phrase like a warm coal cupped in both hands so it will not go out. At the last rung you pause only long enough to feel the collar give you back your shape, and then you climb until the river’s cool breath opens your lungs like a gate.
choices.outcome: You escape unseen, and the phrase you carry is as clean as a bell-tone struck in an empty hall. Neris recognizes it on the first telling and names it a tide-clock cipher that only Kelvar boardroom voices use when the doors are double-bolted. She takes it down in careful ink with her left hand while her right hand seals the paper under a copper ward, and her smile is a thin thing that glints like a scholar’s scalpel. The Collegium commits instruments and fast couriers to your side without haggling, because provable complicity is the music they need to play the council like a drum. The Order hears a whisper that a Kelvar phrase was spoken where no record should be, and suspicion angles toward Thane like a heron’s beak, though no net tightens yet. In the markets, nothing changes tonight, but currents shift one hand-width in your favor, and those who favor darkness feel a draft they cannot name.

choices.title: Pluck the Note, Force the Names
choices.text: You touch the harmonizer pin Neris lent you to the collar’s iron and flick it with a fingernail at a moment when the Shard’s hum softens. The blue fog trembles as if a quiet gasp passed through the room, and the prisms sweat an extra drop of light that rolls like a bead of quicksilver along an unseen seam. The masked figure pauses and requests verification in a whisper that turns formal, and the warden answers with an oath-fragment that demands a countersign from Thane. Pride does the work of your sabotage, and Thane supplies the countersign with a flourish and the very ciphered phrase you came to catch, speaking it louder than he intends because he enjoys being necessary. Lysa calls for calm and insists the chamber is secure, but her head tilts by a hair too much as if listening for footsteps hidden inside the iron. You feel the collar’s skin change under your palm as if it were a living thing smelling your fear, and you pull back just in time to avoid a shaft of ward-glow that would have painted your outline on a prism. The ladder greets your hands like an old friend who asks no questions and only lends you its rungs, and you climb into night with your heartbeat counting victory against your ribs.
choices.outcome: You secure the tide-clock cipher phrase, but the Order’s warden leaves the meeting with her suspicion pricked and pointed at a direction that brushes the toll tower. Neris records what you bring and winces at the residue of ward-touch on your sleeve, then scrapes it away with a glass blade before it can name you to the wrong ears. The Collegium moves swiftly, but carefully, granting you runners and a chart-room at night while publicly speaking of weather calibrations to avoid stirring the city’s nerves. Order suspicion against Kelvar rises when the warden tests the phrase on a sealed writ and finds it sings true, yet she also posts an extra pair of eyes near the Chainbridge ladders for reasons she does not declare. You carry a faint harmonizer burn on your thumb that aches when the Shard hums, a reminder that music and law both leave marks when plucked. The city does not know your name for this, but the river seems to breathe a touch easier as boats slip under the bridge before dawn.

choices.title: Speak the Oath and Strike the Fear
choices.text: You step from shadow as if it were a curtain and hold your copper ward-tile up where the prisms can see it, because an oath is a light that can make even liars squint. Words spill from your mouth in the cadence of river oaths, the old kind learned in Murkwall where a hand on the rope matters more than a stamp on paper. You swear you will carry their plan like a stone to the House of Reconciliation and set it on the table where arguments polish truth, and you invite them to deny you before the ward that hangs like a quiet moon at your throat. The warden’s hand twitches toward her baton, but ritual catches her wrist like a friend who knows which doors cannot be opened without consequence, and she speaks of process instead of force. The masked voice tilts with interest and plays at courtesy, offering you a safe departure if you swear to misquote what you heard, and Thane scoffs and calls you a grandstander while his fingers brush his chain-beads in a nervous secret count. You answer by hammering the ward-tile to the iron with your fist so the sound travels, and the echo makes them flinch because the chamber remembers promises and hates to be lied to. In the wake of that echo, you turn your back on them the way a river turns its back on a stone it has decided to carry downstream rather than grind to sand.
choices.outcome: You leave with a sliver of scented wax stamped by Kelvar signet under your nail, torn when Thane reached for the ladder rail and his seal brushed iron, and Neris proves it bears a ciphered micro-knot that answers to the tide-clock phrase when touched with heat. The masked figure lets you go with a sugar-soft promise that kindness can be recalled like a loan, and you feel the bloom of a mark you cannot see dry on your shoulder where the fog kissed you. The Collegium’s support arrives loud and fast, because public confrontation demands quick scaffolding before rumor hardens into law, and their instruments hum to your tune without waiting for committee. The Order’s suspicion of Kelvar spikes when the wax knot tests true against a ritual basin, but the warden files a parallel notice that a rogue oath was spoken under the Chainbridge, which paints a thin red circle around your name in a private ledger. You are not captured, you are not silenced, but you are seen, and the next steps will walk heavier because steps in full light always do.

choices.title: Trade Shadow for Shadow
choices.text: You do not show yourself to the council, but you address the mask with a rasp of finger-tap code against the iron, the kind only riverfolk and orchard-keepers trade under awnings when rain keeps tongues honest. You offer a rumor that is not a lie, a small truth about a Collegium lens that sings when the Shard does, and you ask for a truth in return graced by their silk rather than your grit. The mask inclines as if the body beneath were tasting the wind, and the Gardener’s splinter answers with a whisper that smells of quince and night-sap and the seriousness of careful gardening. It gives you a phrase that is more than a word and less than a sentence, a timed sequence with a particular hand movement, and you know in your bones that it is a key that opens a door you should not see through too soon. You thread that key into your memory as if it were a knot in a heaving line, and you back away up the ladder while the council continues as if your negotiation were only a change in the fog. When you reach the panel, you pause and taste a sweetness at the back of your mouth that was not there before, like a promise dissolved under your tongue, and you spit twice for luck before sealing the hatch.
choices.outcome: You return with the tide-clock cipher phrase gifted rather than stolen, and Neris frowns at the way the ink seems to dry quicker on it as if it had a will to be recorded. The Collegium backs you with speed and secrecy, but Neris warns that gifts from gardens carry roots you cannot always see, and she binds the paper with both ward and wax to slow any unseen growth. The Order’s suspicion of Kelvar increases when the phrase picks the lock on a sealed courier satchel tied to their accounts, but a shadow-favor now hangs above your head like a ripe fruit that someone expects you to pluck when they whistle. Night Orchard eyes open and close in places you do not expect, and more doors open for you than before, though a few close behind you with a sound like pruning shears. You are not captured and you are not hurt, yet your sleep tastes of sap and your dreams take on the quiet gravity of orchards where no moon dares to look.

rewards.description: Thane’s tide-clock cipher phrase, proving he attended the illegal council.
Collegium support to act swiftly against the planned hum-falter.
Order suspicion increases against Kelvar if you share the token (story branch).
